will pile up bricks, tie knots in the (straight) ink-line, and burrow in (the meanings of) phrases,
they divert their hearts roaming in the region of "the black" and "the white", "the same" and "the different",
and they wear themselves out extolling useless (sophistical) propositions - isn't that what they are doing?
And so all these people cultivate a multiplicity of multiply excrescent ways,
and theirs in not the Ultimate Truth.
but (distinguished as their were) theirs in not the Ultimate Right Course.
Those adherents of the true truth,
they never lose sight of their naturally predestined instincts.
So what they join are not webbed limbs
and what is branching off their bodies are not extra fingers,
when they excel in something there is no superabundance,
what they are short of something there is no deficiency.
but (distinguished as their were) theirs in not the Ultimate Right Course. XY: 應非道德之正以束。"He closes with an echo of 'feidaodezhizheng'."
never lose sight of their naturally predestined instincts.
Thus what they are not webbed limbs
and what is branching off their bodies are not bifurcations;
And so the duck's shins may strike one as (too) short,
the crane's shins may strike one as (too) long
but if you break them (to make them shorter) there will be grief.
What is long by nature needs no cutting off;
what is short by nature needs no stretching.
That would be no way to get rid of worry.
Alas! Kindheartedness and righteousness would seem not to be part of the essence of man.
Those adherents of what is ultimately right,
such strategies are not apt to remove any troubles.
Thus what they link up with are not webbed limbs
and what is branching off them are not bifurcations;
what they fall short there is no deficiency.
And so the duck's shins may be short,
Thus what is long by nature is not not something one should break,
After all: why is it that the kindhearted have so many troubles?
but on the matter of being in trouble they are alike.
strain their eyes in their worry about the threats to this world,
look grim in their worry about the threats to this world,
frown in their worry about the threats to this world,
they break apart their naturally predestined instincts in their greed for status and wealth.
And thus, alas!, kindheartedness and righteousness are not part of the reactive essence of man.
And thus, alas!, benevolence and duty are not part of the essential instincts of man.
they destroy the unity of their naturally predestined instincts in their greed for status and wealth.
what has this hubbub (about this morality) been all about?
The fact is that if one relies on hook, inkline, compass and L-square to get to be right
what a hubbub there has been! XY: 喧嚷不寧皆以為仁義故。... 既憂則囂囂多事也。
this means cutting away its inborn nature;
that means one is truncating one's Virtue;
if one bends and bows for ritual propriety and musical dignity
and one splashes oneself with the colourful appearances of kindheartedness and righteousness
so as to relieve the minds of mankind,
this is to lose sight of what is forever so in one.
Mankind has something that is foreover so in mankind.
this is to lose sight of what is constant in one.
Everyone in the world has something that is constant in him
That which is forever so,
That which is unchanging in one,
when it is bent, it is not so by the hook,
when it is square it is not so by the L-square,

Their not being acceptable consists in their not being accepbable.
And in that way mankind beautifully lives on
and has no idea why it does live the way it does;
and in the same way as mankind everything gets to be the way it is
and has no idea why it does get to be the way it is.
and they have no idea why it was that they have come about.
And all creatures in this world are spontaneously tempted into existence
and this (what is forever so) cannot be iparied.
So then when it comes to kindheartedness and righteousness
why does it force things together like glue, lacquer, cords and ropes
to mess about in the realm of the Way and of Virtue!
So to bring confusion to mankind.
thus bringing confusion to mankind.
In fact, just a little confusion can upset proper procedure;
great confusion will upset the basic nature of things.
How do we know this?
Ever since Shun summoned kindheartedness and righteousness so as to mess up mankind,
mankind, without exception has sought refuge with kindheartedness and righteousness to save their lives.
Is that not exactly to upset one's basic nature through kindheartedness and righteousness?
Is not that to change one's basic nature and replace it by benevolence and duty?
And all creatures in this world are spontaneously tempted into existence XY: 誘然：若有所導之以生者。
and they have no idea why it was that they have come about. XY: 自然生耳。
and has no idea how it was that they got there.
And so in ancient times and in present times this has been no different,
and they cannot be imparied. XY: 不可以人所為損之。"It is impossible to reduce them through human action."
roam among the Way and of Virtue (where they have no business)
messing about among the Way and the natural endowments of things (de) (where they have no business)
In fact, just a little confusion can bring change everywhere,
great confusion can bring change to the very nature of things.
Ever since Shun summoned up benevolence and duty, thus creating havoc in the world,
what are these doing, forcing things together like glue, lacquer, cords and ropes
but great confusion can change the very nature of things.
all the world has fled for their life to benevolence and duty.
Is not that to change one's basic nature and replace it by benevolence and duty? XY: 莊子痛懲仁義本念。 "Zhuangzi bitterly attacks the basic notion of benevolence and duty."

Is not that to change one's basic nature and replace it by benevolence and duty? XY: 接惑字發出易性之傷。是莊子痛懲仁義本念。 "Continuing from "confusion", in this Zhuangzi bitterly chastises the basic notion of benevolence and duty."
everybody has fled for their lives to (find refuge in) benevolence and duty.
mankind - without exception - have upset their inborn basic nature by mere things (external to that nature).
mankind - without exception - have upset their inborn basic nature for the sake of mere things (external to that nature). XY:

the gentleman, he will sacrifice his very person to die for fame,
and these creatures cannot be imparied. XY: 不可以人所為損之。"It is impossible to reduce them through human action."
what are these doing, continuously forcing things together like glue, lacquer, cords and ropes
Ever since Shun summoned up benevolence and duty, thus messing up this world,
everybody has fled for their lives to (find refuge in this) benevolence and duty.
mankind - without exception - have upset their inborn basic nature for the sake of mere things (external to that nature). XY: 外物。
their fame goes under different names,

were minding their goats together, and they both lost their goats.
were minding their goats together, and together lost their goats.

he was enjoying himself with backgammon and chess:

he was enjoying himself with dice games:
he was playing dice games to enjoy himself:
and the Robber Zhi died for profit above Dongling:

Mankind, the whole bunch of them, sacrifice themselves.

In fact those who subordinate their natures under kindheartedness and righteousness
even if they are in every way successful like Zeng and Shi
if one subordinates one's basic nature to the Five Tastes (which dominate culinary dogmatism)

then even if one gets in every way sophisticated like an Yu Er,

but one is not what I would call sharp-sighted.
What I call commendable does not refer to kindheartedness and righteousness;
it is being commendable with respect to one's Virtue, that is all.
What I call commendable does not refer to benevolence and duty;

does not refer to what is said to refer to kindheartedness and righteousness:
